resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kou commented on issue #3157: ARROW-3996: [C++] Add missing packages on Linux
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3157#issuecomment-446142635
 
 
   Thanks.
   
   Does we need to install `libjemalloc-dev`? We always use vendored jemalloc in master.
   
   I think that `autotools-dev` isn't a suitable package for installing Autoconf. It's a package for building .deb packages. Can we use `autoconf` instead of `autotools-dev`?

----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

kabukawa commented on issue #3157: ARROW-3996: [C++] Add missing packages on Linux
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3157#issuecomment-446154695
 
 
   Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, jemalloc is not installed. Install libjemalloc-dev log below
   
   ```
   kabukawa@kabukawa-HP:~/arrow/cpp$ sudo apt install libjemalloc-dev
   [sudo] password for kabukawa:
   Reading package lists... Done
   Building dependency tree
   Reading state information... Done
   The following additional packages will be installed:
     libjemalloc1
   The following NEW packages will be installed:
     libjemalloc-dev libjemalloc1
   0 upgraded, 2 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
   Need to get 239 kB of archives.
   After this operation, 1265 kB of additional disk space will be used.
   Do you want to continue? [Y/n]
   ```
   
   > Can we use autoconf instead of autotools-dev?
   
   Yes. autotools is include autoconf, but must not need.
   
   > add g++ 
   
   Sorry, /usr/bin/c++ used.
   
   ```
   -- Check for working CXX compiler: /usr/bin/c++
   -- Check for working CXX compiler: /usr/bin/c++ -- works
   ```
   
   This is contained build-essential package.
   
   > libboost-regex-dev too?
   
   I Retry build after remove this, please wait.
   
   After checking by myself, issue a pull request again.
   Please disapprove this request once.

----------------------------------------------------------------

kou commented on issue #3157: ARROW-3996: [C++] Add missing packages on Linux
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3157#issuecomment-446156775
 
 
   > Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, jemalloc is not installed. Install libjemalloc-dev log below
   
   Ah, sorry. "vendored jemalloc" means that "jemalloc in Apache Arrow not in Ubuntu system".
   If you can build Apache Arrow at master without `libjemalloc-dev`, we don't need to install `libjemalloc-dev`.

kou commented on issue #3157: ARROW-3996: [C++] Add missing packages on Linux
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3157#issuecomment-446183533
 
 
   Autotools is needed to build vendored jemalloc.
   If we vendor `autoconf`-ed jemalloc, users don't need to install Autotools.

----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #3157: ARROW-3996: [C++] Add missing packages on Linux
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3157#issuecomment-446239302
 
 
   Indeed, please remove `libjemalloc-dev` as we do not support system jemalloc at all. It is not required to use jemalloc if not desired (pass `-DARROW_JEMALLOC=OFF`)

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kabukawa commented on issue #3157: ARROW-3996: [C++] Add missing packages on Linux
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3157#issuecomment-446247000
 
 
   I confirmed it again in the initialized environment.
   I think that compilers are sure to have you use "build-essential" package.
   
   In conclusion, what was necessary additionally is
   
   * boost_regex
   * autoconf
   
   There are only two of them.
   
   boost_regex gets an error like the following when executing cmake command and stops.
   
   ```
   - Found pthread: /usr/lib/x86 _ 64 - linux - gnu / libpthread.so
   CMake Error at /usr/share/cmake-3.10/Modules/FindBoost.cmake: 1947 (message):
   Unable to find the requested Boost libraries.
   Boost version: 1.65.1
   Boost include path: / usr / include
   Could not find the following Boost libraries:
   
              boost_regex
   
   Some (but not all) of the required Boost libraries were found. You may
   need to install these additional Boost libraries.
   BOOST_LIBRARYDIR to the directory containing Boost libraries or BOOST_ROOT
   to the location of Boost.
   ```

----------------------------------------------------------------

kou closed pull request #3157: ARROW-3996: [C++] Add missing packages on Linux
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3157
 
 
   

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

diff --git a/cpp/README.md b/cpp/README.md
index 7d0851762c..1278ca046d 100644
--- a/cpp/README.md
+++ b/cpp/README.md
@@ -36,9 +36,13 @@ Building Arrow requires:
 On Ubuntu/Debian you can install the requirements with:
 
 ```shell
-sudo apt-get install cmake \
+sudo apt-get install \
+     autoconf \
+     build-essential \
+     cmake \
      libboost-dev \
      libboost-filesystem-dev \
+     libboost-regex-dev \
      libboost-system-dev
 ```
 


 

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
C / C ++ version of Ubuntu Linux environment requires less library / component description.

Requirement
* g ++
* autoconf
* Jemalloc

In accordance with the above, you need to add the following to the library / component you install with apt-get install.

* libboost-regex-dev
* libjemalloc-dev
* autotools-dev
fields.environment: Ubuntu Linux(Include Ubuntu 18.04 LTS on Windows 10 WSL)
